Articles.Content: While mapping stuff It was immediately obvious that the way the game figures out the biome locations is prone to slivers of biomes where they were not intended. One very curious one was an intersection of 6 biomes on the Mun, with two more a little over 5km away. Both have relatively flat areas to land too. Figured it might come in handy for churning out some science in the lower tiers. Could also make for an interesting tier 0 trip. (Can store surface sample for each, right?)

Yes, and Eve reports, more fun is that this is within jetpack range.

Found that landing many places on the edge to the like 74, -50 give you poles, polar lowland and polar crater in addition to highland crater, midland and northwest crater. This just leaves out four biomes, Twin, East, Farside and twin craters.

-1.5, 138 put you between twin and midland craters.

East and Farside crater require separate landings.

Edited November 6, 2013 by magnemoe
I vote for sticky-ing this thread
I think this is great, thanks! Now I have a function for a Mun Rover mission
